1:02 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW + LTF TRADES

9:25 - BTC TA

  • When the level is old and it had been tapped in the past, Daniel would normally not mark it on his chart anymore but if the level is still very respected and important, he leaves it on
  • Daniel always marks the lower VAL and the higher VAH
  • When there is a nPOC with no confluence it is not so probable that the price will bounce there but when there are a few POC’s on or close to nPOC, it is a very strong level
  • Also, if nPOC is at the important level it adds to confluence
  • nPOC’s do not always give reversals but in general they offer good scalp trades (1-5% in general)
  • The overall low and the low of an impulse are both valid to pull from - consider the one that is more respected as it may work best
  • It is more likely that the less steep trend line will be more respected
  • When there is a psychological level on ETH being hit and BTC is also hitting support it is likely it bounces (nice confluence)
  • Daniel is good at having entries from exact lows and exact highs (he is always well prepared)
  • It is very helpful to have a line in the sand from which you can expect much lower/much higher
  • Wave 4 cannot come into wave 1 - invalidation
  • As a trader, you need to be prepared for every possible scenario

54:49 - Q&A

  • You can recognize high liquidity areas from experience - where would people put their SL’s?
  • Daniel generally just uses 0.618 and 0.75 on speedfan
  • With waiting for HTF market structure change you miss the move if you are waiting for the move but it is good to be aware of it
  • EWs are very helpful as they have clear invalidations
  • Daniel uses diagonal trendlines only with EW counts
  • CME gap is good to be aware of but not to base a trade off of it

1:06 - BTC TA

  • Daniel covers EW count
  • He charts on Coinbase chart as it has more history
  • He checks the potential wave 5 targets on log scale and on normal scale
  • Game of probabilities is always changing
  • Sometimes you need to be aggressive with entering trades
  • You always need to know how much you want to hedge your portfolio, how much you are willing to risk on trades (R:R ratio)
  • Daniel is constantly hedging in order to protect his capital and is not/less bothered if the price goes up without him taking a trade
  • When price drops he is not only loosing BTC but also spot value - that is why he is much more aggressive on shorts
  • Wave 4 can either be running flat (very bullish) or expanded flat
  • Daniel is not bearish, he is just very good at hedging at very high levels
  • When bullish, every drop is a gift
  • Significant low on significant time pivot offers a very good trade
  • Daniel uses trendlines as invalidation on EW count
  • When price holds a trend line there is a good probability of price going higher
  • Breaking a trendline equals a major break in an uptrend followed with a major retracement

57:20 - Q&A

  • Breaking 2-4 trendline would mean wave 5 is in
  • MS is number one

3:38 - BTC TA

  • Once you have the skill of knowing how to trade you can trade anything
  • Patterns are often times counter traded that is why it is best to simply short resistance and long support
  • When BTC is range bound the opportunity is with altcoins

20:57 - ETH TA

23:21 - SHIB TA

  • Regarding Fibonacci there are various ways to pull from
  • Daniel uses Fibonacci with EWs
  • He also uses Fib extension with the pivots of ABC correction (EW)

44:13 - DOT TA

52:08 - ATOM TA

  • Spring in accumulation pattern is a very good opportunity
  • Hedging is important because nothing in trading is certain, there are only probabilities so you have to protect your money
  • Hedging when you have a lot of capital is very profitable because you get paid funding
  • Shorting is very important when there is a big resistance and high funding

1:04:33 - Q&A

  • Daniel always wants to see the reaction at the level he is interested in and he trades based off of the reaction

1:09 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW

7:47 - BTC TA

  • Daniel cares more about protecting his capital that is why he holds onto shorts longer
  • When POCs lay on top of each other it is a very strong level
  • Trades are to be had at the lows and at the highs but in the middle of the range taking a trade is a gamble
  • If there is no good trade set-up, don’t force it

39:46 - ETH TA

41:29 - BIT TA

  • When there is little data about a coin it is difficult to trade

48:39 - ADA TA

51:17 - DOT TA

52:33 - XTZ TA

54:47 - ATOM TA

  • In accumulation, you can expect heavy pull backs

56:16 - ALGO TA

57:32 - GRT TA

59:55 - LTC TA

1:00:13 - ALICE TA

1:00:32 - SHIB TA + POSSIBLE SET-UP

  • It respects technical very well

1:08:04 - Q&A

  • For Daniel alt season is a meme - he trades alt if there is a good set-up
  • When breaching ATH and volume is still low it is not bullish. Daniel does not trade based of this information solely but he is just cautious, hedged and prepared for a (big) drop

1:49 - BTC TA

  • Whatever goes up fast can go down just as fast
  • Daniel covers EW count possibilities
  • Look for a running flat first but if it is lost, look for extended flat
  • You need other tools to trade from because EW count is still in the making, no one can know for sure
  • There is always an invalidation point which eliminated possibilities
  • Bearish count becomes likely when support levels are lost - until they hold there are still bullish perspectives
  • Expanded flat can be much more bullish
  • When you find the fractal that has been very respected you should be aware of it
  • When harmonic lines up with Fibonacci time it is very powerful while Fibonacci time alone is not as helpful (but it is good to be aware of it)

44:24 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Whenever you want to counter trade patterns you should look for a reclaim to have a defined risk (SL)
  • Always think in probabilities
  • You have to be prepared for any scenario - know levels you want to trade to the upside and to the downside

58:11 - Q&A

  • Daniel only trades level to level
  • There are different flats in EW theory
  • It is good to be aware of HTF CVD divergences but they do not offer a trade so they are not too important
  • Daniel likes to use CVD on LTFs (even 1 minute)

2:45 - BTC TA

  • With a lot of people on the sidelines, BTC funding is not so extreme even at the high prices
  • Bybit has the biggest volume
  • Trade the chart not the news, though being aware of an important event that can affect the price is a good idea
  • Always protect your capital (hedge)
  • It is better to be safe (hedge) and lose the trade than lose a lot of money if price drops hard
  • Keep in mind being overexposed can be dangerous
  • If you miss the trade there is always another really good trade
  • For every trade - winning, missing or losing - you should log it in the journal and write down the reason why
  • If you are only keeping your money you are better than 95% of people who are losing money in the market
  • When you are pre-setting orders you think you ‘know’ what is going to happen but trading is a game of probabilities so it is way better to set an alert and trade based off of the reaction
  • Trading what is happening at the time on LTF gives you high probabilities
  • It is all about mindset, all about psychology and consistency
  • Focusing on getting rich fast gets you rekt
  • With good risk management losing a trade does not matter
  • Also, cutting your losses fast is very important
  • Taking a big loss makes it difficult to make back your money
  • Be fearful when others are greedy and be greedy when others are fearful (extreme points). Be prepared for any scenario

59:55 - ETH TA

1:01:03 - Q&A

  • The more price tests the level the weaker it gets

0:46 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW

2:48 - BTC TA

  • When BTC is range bound, first sign of weakness is when it loses range
  • In bull market, you hold your longs longer and shorts are quicker
  • When the rise is backed by low volume it means people are not entering (possibly waiting for lower)

28:31 - ELLIOTT WAVE COUNT

  • In a wave four there can be a flat or an extended flat
  • The lower the price goes the more bullish it is as there is still wave five coming
  • EWs give you the perspective where the price can go but you still have to trade in terms of probabilities
  • Always trade level to level
  • With each level lost probabilities increase of price going lower but until support holds there is no reason to be bearish
  • There are Fibonacci tools that can give potential ATH targets but as there are no real levels it is speculative

42:50 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Swing trade can have a large invalidation but you can approach it by laddering into a position or enter on a MS change / sign of strength

48:30 - Q&A

  • You can trade BTC when it goes up, down or sideways - all you need is to mark out levels you want to trade from and let the set-up come to you
  • Do not trade just random levels

1:20 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW

  • Sometimes it is good to delete everything and approach the chart with fresh mind and new viewpoint.
  • It is good to remove prior biases that you had and then see if
  • Daniel likes to mark the higher level going upwards
  • Daniel pulls fixed range from different pivots to get a clearer picture
  • Fib speed fan is a big resistance and it is an extremely powerful tool
  • Hold on to your plan until the invalidation
  • Claiming VWAPs is a good sign
  • Always trade level to level
  • POC on SPs does not offer a good support level - it is not a high probability trade
  • Massive support can turn into massive resistance if flipped

51:25 - Q&A

  • On speed fan .618 and .75 levels are best for Daniel (they are the most respected levels)
  • NLs and NSs are just the estimates, they cannot be trusted data, the only trusted data is the OI
  • While supports are held, it is bullish
  • It is good to acknowledge CME gap but Daniel would not trade based off it
  • For Daniel, EWs are the most helpful with the use of Fibonacci
  • When there is a high probability trade you have to go for it
  • It all comes down to having a plan

Swing trading is all about being prepared and patient. You make a plan and trade a plan.

5:29 - BTC TA

  • Acceptance into the previous range VAH makes probable that the price will retrace to at least POC if not VAL
  • Change of MS changes the probabilities (sign of strength)
  • In trading, you do not need to know what will happen next to make money. You just need to know the levels to the upside and to the downside that you would like to trade and wait for reactions
  • When you are swing trading do the hard work, set alerts and when the trade comes to you, take it and don’t be emotional

24:13 - Q&A

  • On every single trade Daniel takes profit one quickly and then moves his SL to entry (or breakeven) and let the trade run
  • His perspective on trading is not to make the maximum amount of money but consistent gains
  • Daniel also prefers to get stopped out and enter a new trade than compounding the trade unless he planned for it in advance
  • Statistically speaking double bottoms are very likely to be taken out but if double bottom happens on the weekend it is not that likely (less liquidity)

36:38 - ETH TA

39:32 - ALTCOINS QUICK OVERVIEW

  • EOS, BCH, LTC, LINK, ADA, UNI, AAVE, SUSHI, MATIC, XTZ, XTZ, DOT, ATOM, GRT, ALGO, SOL

47:36 - Q&A

  • Daniel sometimes lets his scalp trade run and turn into a swing trade

3:04 - BTC TA

  • Victor leaves more significant levels on a chart
  • When price touches the level for the second time it is not so strong anymore
  • When you look at the HTF, you look for days or weeks of PA
  • At times ES and BTC are strongly correlated

40:12 - TOTW

  • Victor goes through potential set-up
  • He would wait for the reaction and not pre-set
  • The important thing is to make a plan and stick to it

45:52 - Q&A

53:30 - ETH TA

55:41 - XTZ TA

1:01:32 - DOT TA

1:03:24 - SOL TA

1:05:09 - SUSHI TA

1:07:16 - Q&A

  • You have to pay attention how price gets to the level of resistance or support (aggressive longs/shorts etc.)

4:47 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW

  • Context is extremely important
  • Longs are only trapped once there is a proper rejection and loss of a support
  • Always trade the chart and not your bias

16:28 - BTC TA

  • Daniel goes through possible HTF harmonic patterns
  • It is good to be prepared for any type of a move but, of course trade the highest probabilities
  • Pitchfork must be well respected
  • Big retracements of BTC equal a very good buying opportunity, they are very healthy and bullish
  • When it looks as a little bit of a gamble, it is best to not take a trade

45:40 - XTZ TA

51:45 - DOT TA

55:04 - SUSHI TA

56:36 - SOL TA

59:20 - ALGO, ATOM TA

1:06:35 - Q&A

  • You do not need to know what is going to happen next to make money. All you need to know are levels to the upside and to the downside you’d like to trade

0:40 - PREVIOUS WEEK REVIEW

3:27 - BTC TA

  • Daniel prefers untapped levels only
  • It is best to short only on very strong HTF resistances
  • When POC’s are on top of each other, it is a very strong level
  • If the new channel was also respected in past, it gives you nice confidence
  • Trading a harmonic from point B is extremely speculative
  • If something changes in the market you have to adapt and not trade your bias

33:14 - Q&A

  • Always trade level to level
  • X waves are failed impulses
  • EW’s are good but you need to know when to use them and when not - just like some other tools

45:14 - LTC TA

  • Daniel does not really like to trade LTC because it does not perform well

NOTE: Daniel’s favourite coins to trade are LINK, ADA, AAVE, SUSHI, XTZ, DOT, SOL because they are very volatile

50:52 - ETH TA

  • When Daniel is bullish on ETH, he is bullish on alts in general

55:05 - BTC TOTW

  • Not every week there is a TOTW - Daniel still has one running from two weeks ago
  • He did read the market correct and did not short any of the rise which is important
  • If Daniel is not completely confident he will not give out the trade, he only trades the charts and reacts to what charts are telling him

1:43 - BTC TA

  • When time and volume levels are different, Daniel keeps the more relevant ones, with more confluence
  • nPOC’s are getting really nice bounces
  • If there is no sign of weakness, Daniel does not short
  • Until real rejection, trade the trend
  • It is good to have a ‘connection’ with the market
  • When price goes down very fast, it can go up just as fast (and the opposite - no support, no resistance)
  • From EW point of view price is in a wave 3 until there is a proper rejection
  • EW counts are very adaptable (depending on PA)

43:13 - Q&A

  • When price spends more time at the lows (time POC is lower) but the volume POC is higher, this is considered bullish, because volume is coming in on the rise, which is a good sign. The only way this becomes bearish is on losing the POC
  • dnPOC are very respected levels
  • When a move up is not supported with much volume it does not necessarily mean this is bearish - it might be a controlled move by bigger players
  • Context is very important - with this move up retail traders who are waiting for a pullback are left out (missing out)
    Always trade level to level
  • Your bias can lean to whatever is more probable to happen but you always have to trade the charts - openly change the bias
  • Locking in profits is always important

2:13 - BTC TA

  • So far BTC is keep on flipping resistances into supports on HTF
  • Victor pulls fixed range off the uptrend move and off the last consolidation area around ATH
  • Victor prefers Volume POC to time POC

25:32 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

29:44 - ETH TA

31:14 - SPX TA

31:52 - APPL TA

32:13 - AMZN TA

39:46 - Q&A

0:44 - BTC TA

  • When TV and Exo levels line up together it is even stronger
  • Daniel marks all the levels
  • He looks for a potential harmonic pattern. There are no required pivots yet but it is something to be aware of
  • Flipping last anchored VWAP resistance into support is very bullish
  • Daniel pulled fib speed fan from ATH to the last pivot low before the rally because it is very relevant pull for him

35:26 - Q&A

  • Daniel’s EW did not change as it is a HTF EW
  • There are no high probabilities to put the high in on Saturday (low volume as the bigger traders do not trade on weekends)
  • Daniel always thinks what the majority would do for the heads up
  • He also always aims for a higher level of the Gartley harmonic (.66 instead of .618)

43:57 - POTENTIAL TRADE SET-UP

  • Always trade a chart, not what you want or think
  • Whenever there is an obvious trade Daniel is not keen on taking it

51:19 - ETH TA

  • We do not need to know the direction of the next move but just the levels to the upside and the downside we are interested in

1:02 - BTC TA

  • When there is a very nice breakout you should not hold bias and blindly short every move but go with the trend
  • It is best not to have a bias and just trade the charts
  • Important levels are all you need to know to successfully trade
  • 95% of the time you should be doing TA and 5% is taking the trade
  • When you mark all your levels and price approaches the level of your interest you see in real-time either you will take the trade or not
  • When Daniel is looking for a VAH of the uptrend move, he takes the lower VAH because he would not long too high
  • You should not short just because volume is not good but you have to be aware of it
  • It helps to build bullish and bearish case and see which one is more relevant
  • To short you need to see the sign of weakness

30:30 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Keep in mind that the HTF levels are stronger than intra-day levels
  • This set-up requires a bit of a skill, it is not too easy
  • Daniel would always take a short on a deviation of the range because it would be higher risk for him if he did not (he does not care if the trade goes the other way and stops him out).

41:56 - Q&A

  • There is a potential bump and run pattern
  • If price is below the level, Daniel would mark the highest VA, and if price is above VA level Daniel would mark the lower VA level (short as high as possible and long as low as possible)
  • Breakaway gap is bullish (it should not be filled)
  • Daniel does not really trade off of gaps but he is aware of them

0:47 - BTC RECAP

  • The gap from the previous week turned out to be a breakaway gap (bullish) - there was nothing but strength after the CME open
  • Daniel still has the percentage of the long opened as there was no major rejection and support was not lost
  • Double tops are never to be trusted - they are highly likely to be taken out (SFP)

8:11 - BTC TA

  • Daniel keeps the relevant TA from before and marks whatever changed
  • When something rises so quickly can also go down just as quickly
  • BTC could also range in a bigger range (towards ATH)
  • There is a potential of the bump and run pattern
  • Daniel is not keen on trading second SFP

39:16 - ETH TA

41:20 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • There are a few options but they are reactionary as there are a few levels of resistance
  • Daniel always thinks outside of the box and a few steps ahead
  • He usually takes a day trade based of the reaction and many times it turns into a swing trade

56:16 - Q&A

  • Daniel does not use OBV anymore as he does not see it as helpful anymore
  • Daniel never trusts double tops/bottoms because of the liquidity that is there

1:30 - BTC RECAP

5:38 - BTC TA

  • Daniel marks value areas (volume and time) furthest out
  • Always look for more layers of confluence
  • Daniel does the EW count - it is very good and helpful on the HTF
  • 5-3-5 is more bearish count
  • Always have a bullish and a bearish count
  • In this case both counts are still valid until the range breaks
  • It is good to be aware of the CME gap (it tends to get filled) but not to base a trade off of it
  • A potential of a short squeeze - people do not get the retracement they want and are forced to buy higher or be left out

52:45 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Trade of the week is still maintained from the previous week
  • Until the support is lost, there is no reason to turn bearish (locally)
  • Usually weekend moves result in a fake-out but until support holds you cannot just speculate
  • CME open can be telling
  • As always, trade the range until it breaks
  • CME gap open is important this week because of the context

1:13 - BTC REVIEW

8:20 - BTC TA

  • It is not likely liquidity to the upside stays untouched
  • Even if you do not trade patterns it is good to be aware of them because majority of people trade them so you can counter trade them

20:10 - POSSIBLE SET-UPS

  • Daniel’s preferred scenario is to lose the low (not overall low) as a SFP and short squeeze back up towards the high of the range
  • The best way to shake out traders is to remain range-bound
  • The longer than the range is going on, the more people get bored, shaken out of trades and leaving the market
  • The only people still trading are professional traders, hedge funds, algorithmic bots while retail traders are waiting for a breakout
  • Daniel keeps his short open when price is still under major resistances to hedge himself. And at the same time, he opens long at the lows
  • TOTW is dependent on the run of 30k

33:16 - ETH/BTC TA

  • Altcoin market is very fragile at the moment
  • It is all dependent on BTC, but the downside potential with alts is huge
  • Daniel’s analysis is still the same as the previous week

42:20 - DXY

44:07 - ES1!

  • It is dangerous to time the high on the stock market because it is insanely bullish
  • Until no support is lost you cannot be bearish - all the drops are buying opportunities so far

47:33 - COIN & MSTR

  • Basically, similar to BTC

0:59 - BTC TA

  • BTC sideways range is giving amazing trades and we trade it until it breaks. When it breaks, we are well prepared

12:55 - ETH/BTC TA

  • Daniel does the in-depth analysis on ETH because BTC is still in the range
  • He charts ETH/USD on Coinbase and ETH/BTC on Binance because of history, and trading on Bybit
  • Daniel always does TA on BTC pair first and then USD pair
  • BTC rules all the crypto market and ETH rules all the altcoins (if it drops, alts drop in majority). That is why it is not ok to be overexposed
  • Daniel normally does not short altcoins unless he is given an amazing opportunity
  • It is good to be aware of all possible scenarios and be prepared

30:32 - ETH/USD TA

  • Daniel pulls the fixed range from the impulse and also from the last area of consolidation to get value areas (not the usual way, but works well for him)
  • When it comes to triangle, be prepared to trade it either way
  • When the move up is very quick, move can retrace as quickly
  • Daniel identifies a possible set-up which is on the intermediate/expert level because there are many factors to it
  • Altcoins do well if BTC is ranging

55:11 - Q&A

  • Daniel does not give much emphasis on weekend moves

0:33 - BTC TA

  • Nothing has really changed; previous week’s TA is still valid
  • Whenever there is no trade on BTC, you can trade any other asset - from altcoins to stock market etc. TA is the same everywhere.

18:28 - ETH TA

  • Still in a range but it is a nice trading environment

20:34 - MIKE’S BTC TA

  • Mike subdivides channels (HTF and LTF)

27:37 - DANIEL’S COMMENTS AND Q&A

  • Daniel, Mike and Victor do not trade off of gaps - especially if they happen in the middle of the range

36:21 - STOCK MARKET

  • Even though there might be some nice fundamentals, Daniel only cares about the technical analysis
  • In stock market Daniel’s strategy is buying the dip

43:28 - Q&A

46:16 - ETH POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • As long as BTC is going sideways, there is a good opportunity for trading altcoins
  • Ethereum has to look good for other altcoins also

52:50 - DISCUSSION + Q&A

  • Trading ranges is extremely profitable, even if you miss a bigger move you can make it all up in the range (or even more)
  • It is good to use as many tools as possible to find the confluence
  • Change of MS can happen with or without a selling tail

7:15 - BTC TA

  • Even though BTC is still in the same range, Daniel deletes everything from his chart and does TA from scratch
  • Daniel prefers to check volume on ExoCharts but he also checks it on the TradingView
  • He also re-does the EW counts
  • One always has to have two possible EW counts (bullish and bearish). If one gets invalidated, you are prepared for alternative scenario.
  • One is your preferred account and you trade it, the other one is back-up so that you can know what your next move will be (if invalidated)
  • The reason we trade the range till it breaks is because it offers the most successful trades (extremely high win rates)
  • Daniel discusses his thought process and possible scenarios but without real-time information no-one is able to predict the future (what volume, delta, OI is going to be like).
  • It is good to be aware of various scenarios

48:32 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Even though we’ve been waiting for the SFP of the highs for a long time (and it still haven’t come) set-up stays the same

54:00 - Q&A

  • Sensible TP for Daniel is POC. You can always add it back on when level is lost

8:25 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW

14:16 - BTC TA DANIEL

  • Daniel is marking the levels while Mike and Victor commentate
  • The thing with patterns is that when everybody is looking at the same thing it is not very likely to play out
  • So many people are talking about the dead cross but as a trader you cannot really get much information with this - it does not give you the trade. Whenever it happens you are already late to the move (very speculative)
  • When seeing a pattern, you have to think like a bigger player - how to generate liquidity (counter trade)
  • When price goes up, Daniel thinks about shorts and when price goes down he thinks about longs
  • Mike trades much different when scalping then swing trading
  • Daniel looks at the LTF for an entry even for his swing trades to get the best possible entry and then he takes a TP1 rather fast and lets the rest riding

27:37 - Q&A

  • The tick size matters, for day trading 50 ticks is optimal

52:15 - BTC TA MIKE + Q&A

  • Pre-setting orders can be dangerous, it is better to set an alert
  • Fib time is coming at the end of this month
  • Daniel uses EWs only on HTF and Mike also - he likes to use them with harmonics and speed fans
  • The correlation with stock market is not so strong nowadays but it is still good to keep an eye on it
  • Daniel sees every drop in the stock market as a buying opportunity

1:20:18 - BTC TA VICTOR + WRAP UP BY DANIEL

  • Victor is sticking to trading a range
  • Pre-setting with a good risk management can still be profitable, everyone has to decide themselves what they prefer.
  • The only thing you need to know in trading is which levels you are interested in trading in whichever direction price goes (plan - always be prepared) but you do not need to know what will happen next
  • Trade of the week for Daniel would still be the SFP of the highs around 40k region

2:00 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW + BTC TA

  • Daniel goes through the set-up from the previous week and talks about the next possible scenarios that can happen
  • There is a possibility of a descending triangle if LH’s cannot be broken
  • There is still a possible set-up of shorting the range high but Daniel would not pre-set and would be cautious (he wants to see SFP). No SFP, no trade.

12:33 - MIKE’S BTC TA

18:12 - Q&A

  • Daniel, Mike and Victor do not care about the death cross (200&50 EMA cross) because EMA’s are lagging and it is totally irrelevant to the way they trade
  • Trendlines are very arbitrary - there are different options how to pull them
  • When in no trade, the best swing trades are at the top or at the bottom of the range
  • Best way to trade is setting the alerts and then see the reaction
  • In Daniel’s opinion, it is much more bullish to break down from the descending triangle than running the highs first
  • Daniel doesn’t care if he misses a trade
  • Mike sometimes trades back-test of a break out but only as a scalp or day trade. But if he sees the momentum is great he sometimes holds it as a swing trade.
  • It is context depended, in general break-out trading is not the best idea

1:08:38 - WRAP UP

  • Patience is a key
  • Always know what type of the trade you are aiming for - if you enter a scalp trade, you take profits early but if you enter a swing trades, you cannot close the trade too early

4:40 - BTC TA

  • Daniel deletes everything and starts from the scratch
  • He marks all horizontals, POC’s, fibs etc.
  • He also does the EW count where the most bullish scenario would be going sideways for half a year
  • The more bearish count would see BTC go to about 13k
  • The current two-week range is very important. Breaking down from it would see prices to 23k region.
  • Daniel plans to stay in a swing short below range POC

49:54 - POTENTIAL SET-UP

  • Daniel never pre-sets but looks for the reaction at the level of interest
  • MS is very important
  • For long Daniel would like a HL to be maintained, and for short he’d prefer the price to SFP’s the highs
  • Also, he points out the alternative set-up - SFP of the lows

56:29 - WRAP UP

  • There always have to be two possible Elliott Wave counts - a more bullish and a more bearish count. The breakout direction of this range will be the factor to decide which count to follow long term (for about 200 days)

1:09:07 - DANIEL’S FINAL THOUGHTS (SPOKEN)

  • Pre-setting is very risky. The safest trade is to wait for a confirmation and miss a bit of a move but have a safe entry

2:05 - MIKE’S INTRO

6:55 - BTC TA

  • Arranging TA tools into folders is very helpful
  • Mike likes to mark all the horizontals and then eliminates those that are not too relevant (no confluence)
  • Mike likes to mark global VAH of the whole Bybit chart
  • He also divides chart into smaller sections/ranges
  • It is good to always be aware of resistances to the upside and supports to the downside
  • When everyone is looking at the same thing it is much not really likely to play out but it is good to be aware of it
  • Fake-outs give very good trades

52:28 - POSSIBLE TRADE SET-UP

  • With the price ranging for a longer period of time, fading a move could be a bit dangerous - you have to monitor price
  • Until the market structure is bearish, short the rally. Also, it depends on the time frame you are trading so there can be various possible set-ups
  • Mike trades based off of the reaction

59:18 - MIKE’S EW COUNT

1:06:52 - Q&A

  • Mike removes levels that get tapped
  • The empty spaces on the chart (TA wise) allow bigger moves to happen
  • When nPOC is almost touched on a higher tick level, Mike likes to lower the tick level to see if it is still there - if it is, it is still a valid level.

2:05 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW

5:20 - BTC TA

  • Keep in mind, when price gets accepted into VAH, there is a good probability for rotation down to VAL
  • Daniel updates the EW count also
  • When asset is very volatile one can use log scale also for fib targets (can also be used for speed fan)
  • Daniel finds some similarities with gold (though BTC is much more powerful, much more volatile than gold)
  • Whenever the asset is in a trend, use original pitchfork and whenever the asset is in a range, use shiff pitchfork.
  • There are always various possible scenarios of the correction Elliott Wave wise (more bullish or more bearish)
  • It is most profitable to trade both sides of the markets (get into a nice long at the lows and get into a nice short at the highs). Daniel closes one of them whenever he has a good reason
  • Daniel goes through potential levels to the downside if the low is broken and levels to the upside
  • BTC had massive drops before so there is always a possibility for BTC to drop much more
  • For Daniel 23k is a massive golden opportunity
  • It is always good to be hedged to protect your capital (rule number one!)

1:00:04 - SUMMARY

  • Daniel has to think price will go lower because of the trend - every resistance is holding perfectly, selling pressure is still coming in (bearish chart)
  • You always have to be prepared for different scenarios and simply trade the charts
  • With the tools we have, we can trade any side of the market
  • It is important to diversify

2:30 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW

5:54 - BTC TA

  • Daniel marks everything from scratch
  • If two levels are close to each other, Daniel likes to keep the higher level
  • He has a bearish bias currently
  • He does the EW again (good confirmation of wave 3 being in and wave 4 correction in progress)
  • Wave 4 can go on for a long time - could go until September even
  • There is a potential of a three drives pattern
  • Until MS changes, it is best to short the rallies
  • It is healthy to get pull backs
  • Note the lower range VA’s - if price is accepted into a VAH, it is likely it will rotate to the VAL of that range. Bouncing from POC of that
  • range offsets the rule
  • Keep an eye on a NY stock market open because it is at the resistance - it has an impact on BTC also
  • Never FOMO into a trade, wait for the next best opportunity

50:18 - POTENTIAL SET-UPS

  • Daniel sets his alerts and he’ll trade based off of the reaction
  • Long term he is still bullish and he finds some similarities with the 2017 fractals
  • It is important to have a plan, to be ready for all the scenarios (bullish and bearish)

NOTE: Q&A is in another video

16:58 - ETH TA

  • Daniel does his TA on ETH/BTC pair and then converts

There are a few possibilities to enter a trade - depends on how aggressive you are as a trader

Daniel deletes everything and charts in silence
This week’s levels are very clean - big support and big resistance
Easily defined levels and a very nice range

38:48 - ETH TA
If not already in a trade, it is always good to wait for a retracement to an important level (that needs to hold)

52:00 - DANIEL COMMENTATES
If ETH is doing well, altcoins do well also
Never FOMO but wait for retracements

55:33 - XTZ TA

57:57 - Q&A
Whatever comes out from the current range will give us the idea where we are on EW chart (level to level)
With EW, you always have to have a bullish and a bearish count
Daniel knows when to get aggressive on a trade
Daniel trades on Bybit only which means he can only long ETH/USD, ETH/USDT or just hold spot ETH
If ETH/BTC looks good but BTC is at a major resistance he would convert spot BTC into spot ETH
If ETH/BTC looks good and BTC also looks good he’d leverage long ETH/USD and ETH/USDT

4:07 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW

10:06 - BTC TA
Daniel always keeps the levels and channels that are very respected in the past because they may come back into play again
Until market structure changes (break the lower high), there is no reason to think price will not go lower
The higher the TF the clearer it is
You have to recognize the early signs of bull market going into bear market or even still being in a bull market but the bigger correction incoming - you have to recognise when to stop buying the dip (till there is a sign of strength - resistance flipped into support)
Daniel goes through EW count to see what is the most probable now
What is the most obvious is the least probable to happen
Three way pullbacks are way more bullish than five way pullbacks
In trading, you have to protect your capital first. It is better to not take a trade than blindly take a trade and loose

50:52 - Q&A
Daniel now thinks we are in a wave 4 correction even if we get above the trendline again (B wave - then short for C)
Daniel does trade altcoins as he is holding USDT also
The easiest way to trade is off of MS
With not taking a trade you don’t lose any money, Daniel never gets annoyed because there is always another opportunity
Anything can happen but you always have to think what is the most probable to

3:55 - PREVIOUS WEEK OVERVIEW

7:06 - BTC TA
Daniel starts from scratch

34:35 - Q&A
Daniel likes to look at things he finds on the chart himself
He has his key levels and trades them
Time POC and volume POC are slightly different, Daniel goes for the higher resistance and lower support. He wants the highest possible level to short and lowest possible to long
Daniel pulls fixed range from different pivots to get different ranges of volume and to see when the most volume was transacted. Locally is more relevant for day traders and bigger range volume is more important for swing traders
Daniel would consider wave 3 being in if 50k is lost. While price holds it, it may still not be in as it is an area of support
Speed fan is debatable where you pull it from. Daniel goes for the low that give the most respected touches and gives a bit more time to the move. Also, the pivot he uses was the range low of that range - which is a significant low for that section of the chart
Daniel favours shorting BTC, so to fully close the short he needs to see some strength.

46:18 - POSSIBLE TRADE SETUP
Losing 50k would flip it into a very big resistance
Daniel stays in his short (simultaneously) until sign of strength
If 50k is lost there is a potential for a very drawn out correction
By looking for different potential scenarios and having plan you are always prepared for the next trade

57:03 - Q&A
Daniel is always in a short in a local downtrend
It is nice to hold your short position when you get a nice entry. Then when price comes to a support area you can open a long (on another account) and keep on holding the short position until you get the sign of strength. So, if long gets invalidated you are still profiting from the short that is running - you are hedged.

3:51 - BTC TA
Daniel marks all the levels
Daniel prefers to take a loss when he sees a good trade opportunity rather than being scared and missing the trade (when you have a proper risk management, loss does not ‘hurt’)

15:18 - MIKE’S VIEW
Mike takes only the highest probability trades and if the trade does not present itself he simply does not trade that day

22:47 - IGOR’S VIEW
Igor is a level to level trader and he likes to trade sessions
Igor removes all the prices on the right side, he just leaves prices of important levels to remove bias and just be focused on that exact level
He likes POC’s and is only interested in big levels
Even when you know everything, you cannot just avoid losses. No one has 100% win rate, we only trade probabilities. You need to learn how to deal with losses.

1:35:25 - DANIEL’S VIEW POINT

4:18 - ZRX/USD COTW

17:03 - ADVANCED FIBONACCI TECHNIQUES WITH PATTERNS

  • ABCD pattern is basic, easy to learn
  • Other patterns stem from this one
  • BOOK: The guide of harmonic patterns EXACT TITLE????
  • Interesting ‘fact’ - so many people lose their money in an uptrend. One of the reasons is because of the complex pullback
  • Complex pullback: price comes through the previous high on the correction. Important thing is that the low holds. It confuses people who trade EW (for instance wave 4 cannot go into wave 1) - that’s why one has to have more than 1 trading strategy

21:46 - CLASSIC ABCD PATTERN (+EXAMPLE)

  • Best on 4H + TF
  • C = between 0.618 and 0.786
  • D = if C is 0.618 then look for 1.618 of Fibonacci expansion from B to C
  • D = if C is 0.786 then look for 1.272 of Fibonacci expansion from B to C
  • Officially you trade the D leg but Daniel trades C leg as well
  • Short or long D (confluence is needed)
    • Take a Fib from A to D
    • Targets: 0.382, 0.618, A (or trail SL from 0.382)
    • SL: below 1.618 expansion from B to C
    • The symmetry between AB and CD is needed (Fib time)

52:10 - BTC TA and Q&A

1:12:57 - AB = CD PATTERN

  • AB is the 1-1 extension of CD (take Fib extension from A to B to C and D is 1-1)
  • Short or long D (confluence is needed)
    • Take a Fib from A to D
    • Targets: 0.382, 0.618, A (or trail SL from 0.382)
    • SL: below 1.618 expansion from B to C
    • The symmetry between AB and CD is needed (Fib time)
    • Optimal entry 1-1 time Fib on 1-1 extension

8:03 - MY DAILY TRADING ROUTINE

  • Full market scan (watchlist) - 3x a day (morning, midday, evening)
  • Mark coins with best daytrading setups (red)
  • Mark coins with best swing trade setups (orange)
  • Set alerts
  • Get a feel for a coin and market before jumping in

18:04 - SCALPING ALERTS

  • You need at least Trading view Pro
  • Setting an alert (oversold):
    • RSI crossing 30
    • Value: once per bar
  • Setting an alert (overbought):
    • RSI crossing 70
    • Value: once per bar
  • Also, set:
    • RSI moving up % 3% in 3 bars
    • Once per bar
  • And
    • RSI moving down % 3% in 3 bars
    • Once per bar
  • For scalp trading Daniel sets alerts for 3, 5, 15, 60 min TF for every coin
  • For swing trading, he uses these alerts on 4h and 1day TF for every coin
  • One has to be aware of horizontals

34:20 - PATIENCE IS THE KEY

  • Wait for a setup to come to you!
  • Do not chase trades!

36:29 - YOU CANNOT AFFORD TO BE MEDIOCRE! AMATEURS NEVER WIN IN THE GAME OF LIFE!

36:48 - RECAP
